snippet.textDisplay: The music style is called for whatever reason 8bit or also chiptune. But infact the NES soundchip was only 4bit except for the dmc channel which could  playback 7bit samples but was barely ever used because of the memory usage.
snippet.textOriginal: The music style is called for whatever reason 8bit or also chiptune. But infact the NES soundchip was only 4bit except for the dmc channel which could  playback 7bit samples but was barely ever used because of the memory usage.

snippet.textDisplay:
@masterplusmargarita 

The vast majority of Robot Masters are the good kind of weird, it's part of what makes these games awesome.  Don't forget Dive Man, he's a submarine with legs!  MM6 has the most unusual RMs, purely because they had a theme of humanoid warriors.  Not saying those RMs are bad either.  I happen to think that toads, pharaohs, light bulbs, dinosaur bones, submarines, drills, rings and vaccum cleaners made for a pretty badass Mega Man game.
snippet.textOriginal:
@masterplusmargarita 

The vast majority of Robot Masters are the good kind of weird, it's part of what makes these games awesome.  Don't forget Dive Man, he's a submarine with legs!  MM6 has the most unusual RMs, purely because they had a theme of humanoid warriors.  Not saying those RMs are bad either.  I happen to think that toads, pharaohs, light bulbs, dinosaur bones, submarines, drills, rings and vaccum cleaners made for a pretty badass Mega Man game.

snippet.textDisplay: How the hell can a robot be a skull man?

snippet.textDisplay: MegaMan IV seriously had the weirdest boss collection of all, except maybe MegaMan VI. Dust Man? Skull Man? Toad Man? Ring Man? Pharaoh Man? Bright Man?  The only two not-weird ones were Ring Man (Whose non-weirdness is debatable) and Drill Man
snippet.textOriginal: MegaMan IV seriously had the weirdest boss collection of all, except maybe MegaMan VI. Dust Man? Skull Man? Toad Man? Ring Man? Pharaoh Man? Bright Man?  The only two not-weird ones were Ring Man (Whose non-weirdness is debatable) and Drill Man
